promise: Create Accountability in Public Education Through Mandatory Testing
evidence: Enactment of No Child Left Behind Act (NCLB), which established mandatory annual testing for students in reading and math in grades 3-8.
H.R. 1 (No Child Left Behind Act of 2001), signed into law on 2002-01-08

promise: Substantial Tax Cuts for All Taxpayers
evidence: Economic Growth and Tax Relief Reconciliation Act of 2001, reducing marginal tax rates across all income levels and increasing the child tax credit.
H.R. 1836, signed into law as Public Law 107-16 on 2001-06-07

promise: Double the Child Tax Credit from $500 to $1,000
evidence: The Economic Growth and Tax Relief Reconciliation Act of 2001 incrementally raised the child tax credit, ultimately reaching $1,000 in 2003.
H.R. 1836, Public Law 107-16

promise: End the Federal Estate Tax ("Death Tax")
evidence: Economic Growth and Tax Relief Reconciliation Act of 2001 phased out the estate tax, with full repeal in 2010; scheduled to sunset and reinstated after.
H.R. 1836, Public Law 107-16

promise: "Be Reluctant Nation-Builders" and Limit Overseas Deployment
evidence: U.S. military invasions and occupation of Afghanistan and Iraq involved prolonged nation-building activities post-9/11.

promise: Implement Education Reform That Will Allow Failing Students to Transfer Schools
evidence: No Child Left Behind Act allowed students in failing public schools to transfer to better public schools.
H.R. 1 (107th Congress)

promise: Lower Taxes for Married Couples (“End the Marriage Penalty”)
evidence: The Marriage Tax Relief Reconciliation Act, passed as part of the Bush tax cuts, reduced the marriage penalty for married couples filing jointly.
H.R. 1836, Public Law 107-16

promise: Pass Comprehensive Energy Reform Including Domestic Oil Production (e.g., drilling in ANWR)
evidence: Attempted to move legislation to allow drilling in the Arctic National Wildlife Refuge, but Congress blocked it during his first term.

promise: Increase Military Spending for Readiness and Modernization
evidence: Department of Defense budgets increased substantially for military personnel, modernization, and readiness from 2001 onward.
FY2002 Defense Budget Request, DoD

promise: Provide Prescription Drug Benefit to Seniors under Medicare
evidence: Medicare Prescription Drug, Improvement, and Modernization Act of 2003, adding Part D to Medicare.
H.R. 1 (108th Congress), signed into law 2003-12-08

promise: Cut the federal deficit in half by 2009.
evidence: Statement in State of the Union

affectedIndustries.name: Employers (offering health plans)

promise: Support the repeal of "Don't Ask, Don't Tell" and ensure equal rights for LGBTQ individuals.

promise: Negotiate and ensure the implementation of the Joint Comprehensive Plan of Action (JCPOA) to prevent Iran's nuclear development.
evidence: Joint Comprehensive Plan of Action (JCPOA)

promise: I will build a great wall on our southern border, and I’ll have Mexico pay for that wall.
evidence: Border wall construction funded by U.S. federal appropriations (H.R. 1158—FY2020/21 Consolidated Appropriations Act), not by Mexico. Over 450 miles of new and replacement barriers were built.

promise: Real change begins with immediately repealing and replacing the disaster known as Obamacare.
evidence: The American Health Care Act (H.R. 1628) narrowly passed the House in 2017 but failed in the Senate. The ACA was not repealed.

promise: Everybody is getting a tax cut, especially the middle class.
evidence: Tax Cuts and Jobs Act, H.R. 1, signed into law December 22, 2017.

promise: The Trump Plan will lower the business tax rate from 35 percent to 21 percent, and eliminate the corporate alternative minimum tax.
evidence: Tax Cuts and Jobs Act, H.R. 1, signed into law December 22, 2017.

promise: I will suspend immigration from terror-prone regions where vetting cannot safely occur.
evidence: Executive Order 13769 (January 27, 2017, “Protecting the Nation from Foreign Terrorist Entry into the United States”)

promise: I will move the American Embassy to the eternal capital of the Jewish people, Jerusalem.
evidence: Official announcement (White House statement), embassy officially moved May 14, 2018.

promise: I promise to renegotiate NAFTA or withdraw from the deal.
evidence: United States–Mexico–Canada Agreement (USMCA), H.R. 5430, signed January 29, 2020.

promise: I will defeat ISIS quickly.
evidence: U.S. Department of Defense announcement, March 2019: End of ISIS territorial control in Syria.

promise: Cancel the Trans-Pacific Partnership.
evidence: Presidential Memorandum withdrawing the U.S. from TPP negotiations, signed January 23, 2017.

promise: Withdraw from the Paris Climate Accord.
evidence: Announcement text, official U.S. withdrawal per State Department
